Topic.Title: Why hasn't the " end of the world " sequester affected the stock market ?

Message.Msg: Ed (strange name for a girl, eh) I would encourage a long hard look at the price dynamics of the major defense contractors...while NOC (just one example) took a dip in Feb, IF months go on with 10% or more losses in billings for the majors they will face some tough choices. For many of the major defense contractors Uncle Sam is really their only customer and their business model(s) never contemplated a need to attract a broader customer base. Oh, and for Yahoo they should be fine...after all who REALLY counts them in the "technology" sector...I sure don't. LOL.

Topic.Title: Why hasn't the " end of the world " sequester affected the stock market ?

Message.Msg: take a look at our defense budget & then think of the the 4 main countries that we are concerned about from a military standpoint. our military budget might be bigger than all these budgets conbined!

Message.Title: Alibaba Is Asia's Top E-commerce Company
Message.Msg: Asia is now the world's biggest online retail market and Alibaba Group, owner of China's top online shopping websites, is the No. 1 e-commerce company in Asia in combined sales, according to Internet Retailer magazine. In its just-published 2013 Asia 500 report, Internet Retailer found direct-to-consumer e-commerce sales in Asia reached $378 billion in 2012, ahead of Europe's 2012 retail web sales of $315.9 billion and the U.S. with 2012 e-commerce sales of $225 billion. "Driven by explosive growth in China—soon to be the biggest single national e-commerce market—Asia is also the fastest growing" e-commerce market, the magazine reported. Yahoo owns 24% of Alibaba Group.

Message.Title: Yahoo Finance NOT being shut down. Being spared. Actually around Passover, being passed over...
Message.Msg: Yahoo! Message Boards website Effective April 1, 2013, the Yahoo! Message Boards website will shut down. Our message boards on individual properties (like Yahoo! Finance and Yahoo! Fantasy Sports) will remain active. We also encourage you to ask and answer questions on Yahoo! Answers, and discuss issues in the comments section on Yahoo! News.
